titles.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate on what documents the Senate should not consider as establishing the meaning of treaties as it decides whether to consent to ratification.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

term.name: Advice and consent of the Senate

bill.summary: 12/8/1987--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Senate that, with respect to treaties submitted for its advice and consent (including the U.S.-Soviet treaty on eliminating intermediate range nuclear forces), the Senate should not request, review, or rely on those documents in the negotiating record that were not shown to the other party.
